item.title: Random items

item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

public int[] randomReward = {1044, 1045, 1046, 1047}; //items available public void handleRandom(int itemId) { //handler int reward = randomReward[Misc.random(50)]; //odds addItem(reward, 1); // gives you a reward deleteItem(itemId, 1); //deletes the item you click c.sendMessage("You recieve a random reward."); //sends the message }

public int[] randomReward = {1044, 1045, 1046, 1047}; <-- Item Id’s you can receive
public void handleRandom(int itemId) {
int reward = randomReward[Misc.random(50)]; <— (50) is the odds?
addItem(reward, 1);
deleteItem(itemId, 1);
c.sendMessage(“You recieve a random reward.”);
}

if (itemId == ####) { <–item id of the random reward
c.getItems().handleRandom(itemId);
}
? just making sure

Read full topic

item.title: Random items
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

Go in ItemAssistant.java and add this:


	public int[] randomReward = {1044, 1045, 1046, 1047};
	public void handleRandom(int itemId) {
			int reward = randomReward[Misc.random(50)];
			addItem(reward, 1);
			deleteItem(itemId, 1);
			c.sendMessage("You recieve a random reward.");
		}

Then in your ClickItem class add:

if (itemId == ####) { c.getItems().handleRandom(itemId); }

Read full topic
